class news2u.models.AdminApproval(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing admin approvals for publishers, editors, and journalists. Fields: - user: ForeignKey to CustomUser representing the user awaiting approval - role: CharField indicating the role of the user - is_approved: BooleanField indicating if the user is approved - requested_at: DateTimeField set to the current date and time when the approval request is created

DECLINE_REASONS = (('incomplete', 'Incomplete Information'), ('duplicate', 'Duplicate Account'), ('spam', 'Suspected Spam/Fraud'), ('other', 'Other (see notes)'))

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id
class news2u.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a news article.

An article goes through various stages from draft to publication, involving journalists, editors, and publishers.

- article_title

CharField for the article title

- article_content

TextField for the article content

- article_photo

ImageField for the article photo

- journalist

ForeignKey to CustomUser representing the author

- publisher

ForeignKey to CustomUser representing the publisher

- editor

ForeignKey to CustomUser representing the editor

- editor_comments

TextField for editor feedback

- submitted_at

DateTimeField for submission timestamp

- is_approved

BooleanField indicating if the article is approved

- status

CharField indicating the current status of the article

- published_at

DateTimeField for publication timestamp

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

STATUS_CHOICES = [('draft', 'Draft'), ('awaiting_editor', 'Awaiting Editor Review'), ('in_review', 'Being Edited'), ('ready_to_publish', 'Approved for Publication'), ('in_review_publisher', 'Under Publisher Review'), ('published_independent', 'Published Independently'), ('published_publisher', 'Published by Publisher'), ('revise', 'Revise')]
article_content

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

article_photo

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

str

article_title

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

articles_in_newsletters

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

editor

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class news2u.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing the user profile. Fields: - User type: Publisher, Editor, Journalist or Reader - created_at: DateTimeField set to the current date and time when the user is created

Extends Django’s User model with additional fields for role management, approval status, and subscription tracking for readers.

user

One-to-one relationship with Django User model

email

User’s email address

role

save(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

subscribed_journalists

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class news2u.models.Newsletter(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a newsletter. Fields: - title: CharField for the newsletter title - content: TextField for the newsletter content - journalist: ForeignKey to CustomUser representing the author - publisher: ForeignKey to CustomUser representing the publisher - editor: ForeignKey to CustomUser representing the editor - published_at: DateTimeField set to the current date and time when the article is published

news2u.views.build_email(user, reset_url)[source]

Build the password reset email.

Build the email template to sendt to the user with the password reset link.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User object

  • reset_url – Password reset URL

Return type:

str

news2u.views.create_article(request)[source]

Journalist is the only user that can create an article. - Can publish independently - Can submit and publish via publisher - All articles need to be edited by an editor and approved before publication

news2u.views.create_newsletter(request)[source]

Journalist is the only user that can create an article. - Can publish independently - Can submit and publish via publisher - All articles need to be edited by an editor and approved before publication

news2u.views.create_publisher_newsletter(request)[source]
news2u.views.decline_article(request, article_id)[source]
news2u.views.delete_article(request, article_id)[source]

Journalist or Editor can delete draft articles.

news2u.views.delete_newsletter(request, newsletter_id)[source]

Journalist or Editor can delete draft newsletters.

news2u.views.draft_articles(request)[source]

Show draft articles for journalist OR editor

news2u.views.draft_newsletters(request)[source]

Show draft newsletters for journalist, publisher OR editor

news2u.views.edit_article(request, article_id)[source]

Journalists or Editors can edit articles: - Journalists can edit draft articles - Editors can edit articles awaiting their review

news2u.views.edit_newsletter(request, newsletter_id)[source]

Journalists, Editors or Publishers can edit newsletters: - Journalists can edit draft newsletters - Editors can edit newsletters awaiting their review - Publishers can edit draft newsletters

news2u.views.register(request)[source]
news2u.views.register_editor(request)[source]

Handle the registration of a new editor.

Creates a new user account with editor role and sets it to inactive until admin approval. Also creates associated CustomUser, AdminApproval, and Editor profile records.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object

Returns:

Redirect to pending approval

Return type:

HttpResponse

news2u.views.register_journalist(request)[source]

Handle the registration of a new journalist.

Creates a new user account with journalist role and sets it to inactive until admin approval. Also creates associated CustomUser, AdminApproval, and Journalist profile records.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object

Returns:

Redirect to pending approval

Return type:

HttpResponse

news2u.views.register_publisher(request)[source]

Handle the registration of a new publisher.

Creates a new user account with publisher role and sets it to inactive until admin approval. Also creates associated CustomUser, AdminApproval, and Publisher profile records.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object

Returns:

Redirect to pending approval

Return type:

HttpResponse

news2u.views.register_reader(request)[source]

Handle the registration of a new reader (subscriber).

Creates a new user account with reader role and sets it to active immediately. Also creates associated CustomUser and Reader profile records.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HttpRequest object

Returns:

Login Page or render registration form

Return type:

HttpResponse
